content.text:
# Tony Award for Best Revival of a Play

| website     = [http://www.tonyawards.com/en_US/index.html TonyAwards.com]
}}
The Tony Award for Best Revival of a Play has only been awarded since 1994. Prior to that, plays and musicals were considered together for the Tony Award for Best Revival. The award is given to the best non-musical play that has appeared on Broadway in a previous production, or which is determined to be a "classic" or in the historical or popular repertoire despite not having been produced on Broadway. The award goes to the producers of the play. In addition, as of 2019, authors (if living) are also eligible for the award for shows that are considered revivals but that have not previously appeared on Broadway.
